channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3174] Falcon Kick! [Pic]
[+3055] Microsoft Yahoo merger (COMIC)
[+2152] Seven (More) Reasons to Ditch Your iPhone (and AT&T)
item.description: It's been a nasty week for iPhone users. Apple has buckled to pressure from AT&T and denied Google's Voice application from the App Store: a nifty service that helps you consolidate phones and manage your voicemail online.

item.title: [+2143] Apple Tries To Silence Owner Of Exploding iPod
item.description: Apple attempted to silence a father and daughter with a gagging order after the child’s iPod music player exploded and the family sought a refund from the company.

item.title: [+1688] They foreclosed? Bastards!
[+1580] Borrowed a book from the library, look what I found [Pic]
[+1571] Eric Schmidt leaves Apple board over "conflict of interest"
item.description: Google CEO Eric Schmidt has resigned from Apple's board citing conflict of interest. Steve Jobs says that "as Google enters more of Apple's core businesses, with Android and now Chrome OS, Eric's effectiveness as an Apple board member will be significantly diminished."

item.title: [+1195] The Story of How and Why John McCain Picked Sarah Palin
item.description: McCain's search for a running mate had started in the spring with about two dozen names. Palin was not a serious candidate. One person said she wasn't even on the initial list; others said she was -- barely. It was only later in the summer, when the campaign team became alarmed at the size of Obama's lead among women, that she was added to the list

item.title: [+1184] Top 100 Sites Of 2009
item.description: Hottest Web sites and Web trends of the year, some classics & some undiscovered.

item.title: [+1110] 6 Reasons Why You Need to Drink More Coffee
item.description: "Coffee is a complex beverage with hundreds, if not thousands, of bioactive ingredients," he said. "A cup of coffee is 2% caffeine, 98% other stuff."

item.title: [+1067] GE's silencing of Olbermann and MSNBC's sleazy use of Richar
item.description: The New York Times this morning has a remarkable story, and incredibly, the article's author, Brian Stelter, doesn't even acknowledge, let alone examine, what makes the story so significant. In essence, the chairman of General Electric (which owns MSNBC), Jeffrey Immelt, and the chairman of News Corporation (which owns Fox News), Rupert Murdoch,

item.title: [+951] New Anti-Obama 'Joker' Posters Start Popping Up in LA
item.description: A new poster depicting President Obama as a version of Heath Ledger's Joker character in The Dark Knight has appeared in Los Angeles, according to rightwing sources. Blog posters to such online sites as American Thinker and Tammy Bruce are predictably in the throes of political orgasm.

item.title: [+893] Britain To Put CCTV Cameras Inside Private Homes
item.description: British authorities’ love of surveillance and snooping is obvious, but the governments latest plan: to install Orwell’s telescreens in 20,000 homes is just crazy.

item.title: [+883] 5 Things They Say Give You Cancer (And Why They're Wrong)
item.description: Scientists and journalists alike have been conjuring up different ways to scare the shit out of people for decades, their favorite probably being convincing the public that almost everything they come into contact with causes some form of cancer.

item.title: [+828] Epic Neighbor Lawn Chair War Continues [Insane Emails]
item.description: Battle between neighbors over lawn chairs refuses to die. Here, a new chain of emails (w/link to earlier ones, previously posted). One guy obsessed with his neighbor’s lawn chairs is near-crazy. His neighbor is frustrated but funny as hell, & and seems happy to escalate things.

item.title: [+793] Alcoholics Rejoice 18% Beer
item.description: BREWERY chiefs were branded "irresponsible" last night for launching an 18.2 PER CENT beer which they claim is Britain's strongest.

item.title: [+777] 329 hot air balloons
item.description: on their way to the horizonPeople think they're UFOs from spaceso a general sent upa fighter squadron after themSound the alarm if it's sobut there on the horizon wereonly 329 hot air balloons— with apologies to Nena

item.title: [+745] Electronic High-Security Locks Easily Defeated at DefCon
item.description: World-renowned lock experts Marc Weber Tobias, Toby Bluzmanis and Matt Fiddler are at it again. The three, who have made numerous headlines for bumping and picking Medeco high-security locks and other brands, have now succeeded to crack state-of-the-art, CLIQ technology electro-mechanical high-security locks.

item.title: [+697] B-Boy vs. Dog Mascot: Who Ya Got?
item.description: I say Furry wins hands down.

item.title: [+682] Beauty Behind Bars [PICS]
item.description: An inside look at beauty pageants being put on by inmates in women's prisons.
